== Join Us! ==

<nowiki>[[File:dc-loco.jpg]]</nowiki> Welcome fellow Ubuntites, Ubuntunistas, Ubunturists ("Ubunt-tourist"), etc! The DCTeam <nowiki>[[LoCoTeams|LoCo]]</nowiki> covers the Washington, DC metropolitan area, which includes parts of Maryland and Northern Virginia. We focus our efforts on advocating the use of <nowiki>[[EdubuntuWiki|Edubuntu]]</nowiki> in K-12 schools, local libraries, community centers, and housing projects... and wherever else we can think of. <nowiki>[[EdubuntuInstallations|Yorktown High School]]</nowiki> piloted, and remains actively involved in the development of Edubuntu. Other recent accomplishments include a rather successful <nowiki>[[http://maitri.ubuntu.com/softwarefreedomday/wiki/index.php/Washington|Software Freedom Day event]]</nowiki> and the installation of Edubuntu for the <nowiki>[[EdubuntuInstallations|Tenants’ and Workers’ Support Committee]]</nowiki> and both the <nowiki>[[EdubuntuInstallations|Mount Rainier]]</nowiki> and the <nowiki>[[http://cityoftakomapark.org/library/|Takoma Park]]</nowiki> public libraries.

New members of the DCTeam should probably learn how to use GPG, so that they can digitally sign e-mail, files, etc.  In particular, using GPG is required in order to sign the Ubuntu <nowiki>[[http://www.ubuntulinux.org/community/conduct/|Code of Conduct]]</nowiki>, which makes you a true <nowiki>[[https://wiki.launchpad.canonical.com/UbuntuMembership?highlight=Ubuntite|Ubuntite]]</nowiki>. In addition, you become part of the "web of trust". To learn about working with GPG, see the GnuPrivacyGuardHowto page.  See also "<nowiki>[[http://www.youdzone.com/signature.html|What is a digital signature?]]</nowiki>". This <nowiki>[[http://www.hlug.org/presentations/gpg/gpg.html|GPG tutorial]]</nowiki> also looks promising. (You can also contact KevinCole if you get stuck.)

== Local Commercial Support Resources ==

There are a few businesses in the area that are becoming quite interested in Ubuntu and its spin-offs. Some are still learning Linux themselves, but are willing to offer affordable support to non-profits, and others with a limited budget.

* <nowiki>[[http://www.citidc.com/|Community IT Innovators (CITI)]]</nowiki>
* <nowiki>[[http://www.pcretro.com/webstore/catalog/|PCRetro.com]]</nowiki>
* <nowiki>[[http://www.ceo4u.com/|Community Empowerment Operations (CEO)]]</nowiki>
